website_summaries.verdict: If you want a compact megazoom with manual controls and fine photo quality, the Canon PowerShot SX210 IS is a good place to start.
pros: Nice selection of semimanual and manual controls
flexible lens in a compact body

customer_reviews.title: Zoom zoom.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon sx2101S. Accidentally ran over the first one before it was 6 months old. And I like it so much that almost two years later I bought one used via Amazon. Since I had a charger, cables, and battery for spares, I figured it would be a good spare camera to have around. The zoom is just great. The photos are clear and the options for changing shutter speeds, etc., all work well. It's all about the zoom on this camera. Impressive for the size, price, and age of this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Debordante Baratin

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon PowerShot SX210IS. Nothing happened to the first, just bought this as a backup. No, I am not a photographer, but do drop things now and than. Takes magnificent photos, easy to hold, fast enough for stills, video is excellent, battery recycle time is good, and is still rated a top contender compared to newer models. Being quite versed in photography, knowing shutter speed and aperture priority, except for automatic mode, the other modes are just too complicated for my use. In its hay-days, I preferred the manual film cameras such as the Minolta SRTs. But, time moves on.
customer_reviews.author: Bionicman

customer_reviews.title: It is a beautiful color. It takes beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.text: Turns out that I bought this camera as "used" thinking the price was low enough to put with some dents and scratches, but in the end guess what?? Not one dent or scratch.... It is a brand new camera or looks new, and the cables came in their original plastic bags. The downside is that it did not include a charger, but since I was buying to replace the exact some model which I already owned, that little detail didnt mean a thing to me other than one less piece of clutter in my camera storage box. It is a beautiful color. It takes beautiful pictures. At 14X optical zoom it is just a wonderful camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. CARCAMO

customer_reviews.title: Great cemera beyond our expectation
customer_reviews.text: At first, we bought this one because, on the paper, it is good at taking steady photos without blurring problem. But when we start to use it, it exceeds all our expectation from this camera. It's a easy to use point-and-shoot camera, but also a SLR camera with many advance functions. The face recognition function works great as advertised. The HD video was really sharp and clear, although the size of file is huge as expected. It can easily take picture of stars at night with 15 sec. exposure time, and many other cool functions. Althoung the location of flash light makes it a little difficult to hold camera, it is a overall great camera.
customer_reviews.author: H. YU

customer_reviews.title: Great little travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these that I take on my many vacations (I am retired and travel perhaps 3 to 4 months/year. These cameras are just right to carry in a pocket or jacket for spontaneous recording of my travel adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I've had so far!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this camera. It is the best camera I've had so far. Its awesome zoom let's me take great pictures. I was gonna buy Kodak Easyshare Zoom 26x, but after doing some research and talking to a photographer he told me I should go for Canon or Sony. I can say I am very satisfied with this camera!!! Pros: great zoom, very good video quality, 14megapixels takes very good pictures, light weight, not AA battery, I bought an extra battery though so I can take lots of pictures. Cons: flash is not very fast, not very good for pictures in movement, like sports. I love Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Priscila L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not the best button for zooming
customer_reviews.text: I like the PowerShot series, however the one thing I disliked in this camera was the zoom toggle, which was not only side to side which was awkward to use one handed, but additionally it was this little knob which slipped very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Esra Caglayan

customer_reviews.title: Fine camera
customer_reviews.text: Takes great photos. Too many features to mention, and quite a learning curve to learn them all. However, one does not have to. The biggest drawback is the pop up flash which automatically pops up when the camera is turned on. Additionally, your finger easily gets in the way preventing the flash from popping up. This could eventually prevent use of the flash at all. The flash itself is not very powerful. If you can live with that, it is a wonderful compact camera with a great zoom for its size. For $200 (what I paid for it on Amazon) it is a lot of camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Nisenholz

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera ever
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the most versatile compact camera I have ever used. I take photos as proof of progress on construction projects and the telephoto feature allows me to take close-up photos from quite a distance. I own this camera because of it's abilities.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Tanbusch

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: A compact camera with big camera capablities. Yes, it takes some reading on how to use the settings as well as some trial, error and research on how to take a good picture using settings other than "automatic". Once you get that down, you're golden. It's got a big screen, a good zoom for what it is and multiple functions to take excellent and unique photos. I know that I've taken many that do not even need to be photoshopped before printing and framing, the photos were that good, or maybe it was just me. Regardless, I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Winchester

customer_reviews.title: Love this little beauty!
customer_reviews.text: I just LOVE this little beauty. Why did Canon discontinue it? Does everything I ask, and turns out great photos!
customer_reviews.author: Stasia MIllett

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Camera
customer_reviews.text: I can't describe how great this camera is..it is one of my favorite cameras of its class. I am not a photographer and know nothing about taking good pictures but this camera makes me look like a pro-photographer. It has a great great stabilizer for shaky hands (like mine!) and it works nice even without flash for moderate light. I LOVE this camera so much.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.A.LM

customer_reviews.title: Bad video
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Canon point and shoot I've purchased because I was extremely pleased with the previous ones and I wanted one with more zoom. Everything else works great except the autofocus which I depend on. I ended up adjusting the shutter speed for pictures instead of using "auto". The video constantly moves out of focus even though i'm trying to keep the camera steady and on target. I know it is not a camcorder but all of my other digital cameras took adequate basic videos but this will not. I'm disappointed because I wanted all the functions to be adequate in one package.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: I had to return it....
customer_reviews.text: ...because the shutter lag in taking a photo drove me crazy. I'm hoping some of my dissatisfaction with this camera was because I didn't use it enough, but the issues I had were: shutter lag, location of the flash (every time it tried to open, that was exactly where my finger was, and I didn't know how to get it to reopen without turning off the camera and starting over), and as a personal note, I didn't like the feel of it in my hands. My guess is, should I have kept it longer, I would have enjoyed it much more.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Good travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I have several cameras, so I really have not used this very much as yet. The biggest problem I find is that my finger is always on the area where the flash pops up when you turn on the camera. Because of the finger being there, it keeps the flash down which may not be a good thing. I have to try to remember to move my finger before turning it on. Other than that, I am quite pleased with this camera. Love the zoom range, and pixels. I would recommend it for sure !!
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Was supposed to have minor scratches only. Arrived with a dented in corner and a cracked LCD screen. Clearly had been dropped several times. Very misleading description. Case itself was filthy and stained and looked 20+ years old. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JP.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my honeymoon to Europe (it's not 'til September), and I absolutely LOVE it. It's really lightweight for a camera that takes such amazing photos. It's definitely worth the price. I have a blog, and I've had readers commenting on my picture quality...I used a Canon Rebel digital SLR for my blog before. I highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants an easy-to-use, lightweight camera that takes really beautiful, high quality images.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Great- till it stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this, except it suddenly stopped working: would turn itself off without warning after just a few moments. Sent it back to Canon for 'in warranty' repair. We will see. If it worked it would be a five star, for ease of use and great pictures. Only, if you want really fast response time, you have to go to a real SLR- so action shots and fast changing facial expressions- not so much. Everything else, great, and it is a great carry-everywhere camera
customer_reviews.author: gail

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I purchased this camera. The zoom is incredible, I love having the HD video. The features are as good as or better than my bigger camera. There are a few downsides, that are minor compared to how great the camera is. My biggest complaint is the battery/SD card door is very difficult to open, and the side door for the USB could provide better clearance for plugging it in. I never thought I'd get a zoom this good in a camera this small.
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Canon!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love the photos I have taken so far. The low light are fantastic, and the zoom is incredible. The only con I can see is where the flash has been placed as my finger is always there when I start it up. Its going to be just a matter of getting used to holding it differently.Almost over a year later and I still love this camera even more than my rebels It's over 2 years old and still works well and delivers great photos even in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne C. Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: Great 14x Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after much research,just before making a trip overseas, so I had less than a week to use to it before I left. Great camera, was easy to use and I love the 14x zoom. I was able to get excellent pics and video while sightseeing around Prague. I had very good low light pics, in several indoor situations. Even preferred the ones without the flash!! As they had great color and captured the settings better in several unique restaurants that had some mood lighting. Highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Packer fan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a point-and-shoot with a lot of additional features, and this camera is great. The only thing is that the shutter speed is a little slow, and it tends to produce blurry pictures if not shot with great precision. Otherwise, this camera is amazing because it has very artistic effects such as Color Accent. Not many cameras have this feature, and it is tough to even produce that effect on Photoshop because you have to do it manually. Color Accent makes this camera a win for me. :)
customer_reviews.author: AH SUSTAINABLE LIFE

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the camera is very good and has many very nice features. When I purchased it, I really thought that it would be much more compact in size. It is quite large compared with many other point and shoot digital cameras with similar features. I actually had problems finding a case that would fit it properly....they were either too small or too large. Even though I like it, I'm not sure that I would repurchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Leckinger

customer_reviews.title: Pocket power.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this picture quality this little guy puts out. I took in on a road trip recently, and logged in over 1000 photos. After weeding out some, the remaining pics I had were excellent, and all worthy of printing out. Some people have told me that there are a few Nat Geo worthy pics in there, which is always a compliment. Zoom is also fantastic. I will post up some pictures from Glacier Nat. Park showing the zoom quality soon. The size is also a great perk. It fits in a back jean pocket perfectly with no discomfort. Get this camera.
customer_reviews.author: k.supplee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product quality price.. I have used it every day and there are no problems
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Movie playback issue
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, great pictures, but the movie format MOV does not play back, it does it only in the camera. The other Canons that I own use AVI format which plays without problems in any computer. I have tried to download software but videos play back with lines across not showing any of the images. I would like to solve this problem. Unfortunately, Adorama allows only 14 days to return the merchandise, being out of the country taking pictures and movies for 18 days, just now I was able to download the movies to the computer and have no success in playing. Now I am stuck with a great photographic camera but a useless video camera.
customer_reviews.author: "Punkin"

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a couple of years ago. Initially, I was happy with the camera. Then I discovered picture quality is poor with trying to capture photos of a toddler. Sometimes the lens gets stuck in the open position. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had a sony DSW55 for about 2 years, did the job really well, but lately was getting all blurry, so I decided to do some research before getting a new one. Since I cannot afford a DSLR at the moment I chose this one, and I love it. The only down side I would say that it is the position of the flash and sometimes the auto mode doesn't do what it is supposed to do. But if you actually take your time and try to learn about its features I am sure you are not going to be disappointed. It is a excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: V. Sena

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera! I was nervous to buy used but when the package arrived and I opened it, I felt it was brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money Digital camera
customer_reviews.text: Hi all, I ordered this camera a week before and i got it delivered within 2 days . Its an awesome value for money camera.Its sturdy,heavy ,light on pocket camera. The picture quality is very good and neat. Its a good travellers compact camera. I am yet to explore more features in the camera as its got a hell a lot of them. Highly recommended for personal and gifting purpose. Happy clicking MSVG
customer_reviews.author: msvg

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS
customer_reviews.text: What a great little camera! So many features packed into such a small package! This is a great pocket camera with enough features to keep one occupied for a long time to come, and also produces great pictures. The low light feature is especially nice for taking pictures inside without the flash washing the background out. It's a very well rounded camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2nd canon that takes blurry pics
customer_reviews.text: I like the fast response, but this is my 2nd canon that does not seem to take clear pics. Also, when I was video'ing my son's xmas show, the focus kept going in and out in and out. very disconcerting. Finally, I really dislike the location of the flash. I am always accidentally pushing it down. It needs to be integrated into the frame and not be a pop up.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: The camera produces good pictures. But the shutter leg is way too long and when you take videos the focus is slow to react so if you move the camera from one spot to another the picture becomes blurry until the focus adjusts which I find very annoying and I find myself not taking anymore videos because of that, it's that obvious. The pop up flash on the side of the camera is a design flow because it's exactly where you tend to put your fingers when you hold the camera, and you'll find yourself closing the flash again and again without noticing. Edan Aharony.
customer_reviews.author: Edan Aharony

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: I have had Canon cameras for over 25 years. I bought this one after my A620 quit working, which was a fantastic point and shoot camera. I have had this camera for over a year. The pictures are either a hit or miss (totally out of focus even though you let the camera auto focus) and I find myself taking multiple pictures at one time hoping one turns out. It is very slow to respond and having strangers take pictures is totally hopeless. I do not like the quality of indoor photographs, outdoors are very nice. Children and pet setting is worthless, auto is much better. One positive is that I do like the big LED screen.
customer_reviews.author: JMI372

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first.
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked great - for a while. When I was into my second week in Italy, it quit reading a charged battery so I was unable to use it. Good thing I had a camcorder and iPad with me, but what a hassle! I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kuke

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS
customer_reviews.text: Still have tons to learn in the operation of this camera but so far It is the most liked camera I own. Once I am more aquainted with the operation, It probably be my only choice. The only problem I have at the moment is I keep putting my finger on the flash door and inhibit it's opening. This is a small design flaw worth getting used to for a camera of this caliber.
customer_reviews.author: jankay39

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pocket camera. Carried one in my pocket daily for several years before it died. Bought this another one used at a great discount, but it was in excellent condition and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good digital camera for someone like me who isn't a photographer but likes to take pictures and video. Lots of color features, and easy to get them off the camera with the SD card or plug. And the purple color is pretty cute, too.
customer_reviews.author: The Bull

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture Camera, Poor Video Camera
customer_reviews.text: Item received before expected. Item was as expected in Used conditions, but it was hardly Used. I would say box was opened and closed and then, they sold it. I am very happy with this camera, very nice and clear shots. There is only on minor detail. Whenever I am shooting a video the lens tends to go Off focus a lot. So expect a movie with clear and blurry parts.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Chang

customer_reviews.title: 2 years of use
customer_reviews.text: This takes incredible photos if there is a lot of light. But even with every light on in our house, indoors it fails. I know you can play with the settings and I have taken college level photography classes and I still cant get great photos indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for someone who wants great pictures with ease of shooting and all the extras - especially the video option and the smart shooting option so you don't have to guess. Also, the indoor setting gives you great pictures! After buying and using this camera I bought one for my friend and she loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best digital camera I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best digital camera I ever owned. The door will not break like all my others. The OEM batteries have a long life and recharge quickly. Only wish they make this in 1080p movie mode. Flash broke and will not raise automatically anymore.
customer_reviews.author: feldspar3

customer_reviews.title: easy to carry easy to take pics a little work ...
customer_reviews.text: easy to carry easy to take pics a little work and you get even better pics - has many useful features but gives good results when using a grab and snap approach also - longer I have it, the more I learn about it. Time invested in what it will do will increase your appreciation for this little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Southern IL gal

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small, portable camera with a lot of features. I am certainly not disappointed in this camera. I like the powerful zoom which gives me a lot of flexibility in taking various shots. The focus is very good, and the controls are easy to use and understand. Very enjoyable and easy to slip into a pant or shirt pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: iPhone’s better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to place my old one, same model, that broke; took it on a safari; got better pictures with my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Walker

customer_reviews.title: An old friend.
customer_reviews.text: Our other camera was dropped and beyond repair. This is exactly the same - thus like an old friend resurrected.
customer_reviews.author: Marv Ostberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Everyday Camera
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased this camera based on a friend's recommendation and the reviews we read on Amazon. We were leaving for a trip and needed a camera fast. We couldn't be happier with this one! It took pictures in multiple types of weather, in daylight and at night and every picture turned out great. It zooms well too! It does use a lot of memory to make a video, so be sure to get a SD card of 4 or 8 KB.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hillstrom

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to have a compact point-and-shoot that would fit in my purse, the zoom and pixels are fantastic for this size of camera, I wanted to like it more. I love Canon's products but this one doesn't seem to fit the bill. The focus is slow and if you're trying to be quick (like you need to be with kids and pets) 1/2 the photos turn out blurry. The features are nice. The location of the flash is very annoying. The video is great as well as the audio. I can't decide if I'll be keeping it yet but I recommend going to a store and testing the camera before buying.
customer_reviews.author: JLSinSEA

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact camera.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera for travel. Quality camera from Canon...takes great photos. (I have a Canon Rebel but don't want to lug around camera and lense always)
customer_reviews.author: LadyPaddler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compact Camera with 14x Zoom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last month. I haven't explored all the features and settings yet. I've only used the Auto settings to take most pictures and the Video setting. I am impressed with the image quality and zoom capabilities in particular. I have taken pictures of things I couldn't see with the naked eye and the camera has captured those with precision. Video is great quality for a compact and the microphone works well too. All in all, a good buy for a compact camera that fits your pocket and your budget. Yea, as pointed before flash position is weird but you get used to it if you don't own 10 cameras :-)
customer_reviews.author: JohnHancock

customer_reviews.title: Hackable camera with great optics for its tiny footprint.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and compatible with CHDK! Mine arrived with a smudged lens but this was easy enough to fix on my own.
customer_reviews.author: jswjimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, like buying a 91 civic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service from store. Shipped quickly and came with more accessories than listed, including a case. Camera is old but still works well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Will daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera. I previously had an older Canon Digital Elph and it worked great for a while, but I was in search of a larger zoom and a camera that tok stellar photos in low and dark light. I found it in this camera. Recently went on a camping trip and took photos by the campfire in the night setting - photos turned out like it was daylight. I definitely recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Cournia

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for the price, with great features. The pictures taken by this camera are very clear.
customer_reviews.author: rg1231

customer_reviews.title: It was ok
customer_reviews.text: It lasted about a year before having difficulties. It would randomly shut off and the flash wouldn't work. When it would work I was happy with it. Ended up purchasing a Nikon and haven't had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: construction technician

customer_reviews.title: Also isn't very good at handling my shaky hands with any kind of ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK for a small camera. Doesn't handle low light (mornings and evenings) very well or contrasting light situations, such as part of the shot in sunlight and part in shade. Also isn't very good at handling my shaky hands with any kind of zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX210 IS
customer_reviews.text: It is a fairly compact camera that packs a 14X optical zoom lens with image stabilization. A wide LCD display is good for review and play back recording movie. It is very easy to use because simple button. Both the picture and movie quality are good. You could take good pictures in low light condition. You could also adjust the zoom when recording movie. I like to set the dial to `Auto Mode' as I can take picture by pressing the shutter button or record movie by press the movie button. I could still take pictures while recording movie. It is a good choice for traveling if you do not demand too much in photographing.
customer_reviews.author: PC Oakview

customer_reviews.title: Amazon presentation
customer_reviews.text: The camera is all that the reviews said it would be. My only negative comment is that the product description does not list what comes in the camera package. I ordered a separate battery charger, only to find out a charger came in the camera package. It would be helpful if the Amazon description of the product would list what comes with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good when I bought it; now rely on smartphone camera
customer_reviews.text: I liked it fine, but now mostly use my smartphone camera. Prefer to travel light.
customer_reviews.author: EdC

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous camera
customer_reviews.text: The zoom on this camera is amazing! Takes great pictures. Less red eye problems compared to older Canon Powershot cameras. A little bit difficult getting to the menus for Beach, Aquarium etc. especially since it isn't written in the manual. Otherwise, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. It takes beautiful pictures about as well as an SLR camera! The only downfall, is the high amount of megapixels make the videos harder to download. Not a big problem and its worth it for the beautiful pictures!
customer_reviews.author: A. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for, 14 megapixels, 14x zoom, easy to use, nice compact size and great pictures. Lots of options for taking photos in all types of light, huge LCD display screen. It lives up to the Canon name.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Lendi

customer_reviews.title: Zoom Zoom
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a fantastic zoom, and takes great pictures both close and near. It is very easy to use and has on screen help to remind you what all those symbols mean. It's fast and light and the battery seems to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Goldfisch

customer_reviews.title: Great features and pics
customer_reviews.text: I am having a bit of trouble getting the focus I want in the macro mode, but am getting better at it. The pictures are great, clear, crisp and I love all the features such as single color, sepia, etc. Nice compact size and easy to see screen.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy Lizard

customer_reviews.title: Nearly enough
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, but I expected better photographs..... I also bought a big one and the difference is very noticeable.... Anyway, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto D. Pulenta

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x (Purple)
customer_reviews.text: Perfect slim camera with a powerful zoom. Small & lightweight. I have a large camera with a 14x zoom. It is bulky and too large to slip in your purse. This camera has it all for the quick photos you do not want to miss, just point and shoot! For the everyday photos you can not go wrong. The flash placement is awkward and taking some getting use to, other than that I can't say enough about the overall quality of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: maddie

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera; a little bit slow
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice camera; Canon does not disappoint. From my experience, these are the best pictures (and zoom) you can get with such a compact camera. My only complaint is that it takes too long to save between picture and picture.
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: This little thing is very sharp.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is very sharp. It does everything I want and much, much more. I never got the time or opportunity to use more then the two auto features.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Wechsler

customer_reviews.title: Great cmaera, but clumsy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera. The quality of the photos and the features are perfect for us. Our only complaint is that using it is clumsy because of the flash and how it is positioned. It wasn't distracting enough to return the camera and we are hoping we can get used to it. It makes it hard to hold steady for those special shot.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond D. Leroy

customer_reviews.title: Good camera.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and a big improvement over other models from the same company. After years of heavy use it still works well.
customer_reviews.author: dmacker

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot & MAC Smooth Operation!
customer_reviews.text: For those MAC lovers, this camera works very well iPHOTO. I've had it about a week and have been taking photos at school of my students and the photos are so crisp and clear. We're planning a trip to Italy this summer and I wanted a camera that could do it all and be compact. I like the advantage of being able to recharge the battery. I have another Canon digital but it uses AA batteries and drains quickly. This model will work well.
customer_reviews.author: Zamo

customer_reviews.title: hi
customer_reviews.text: Hi. Thank you very much for such products. I am very pleased with this purchase :) It is very practical and very efficient. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: seri07

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera!. I took a nice photos on my vacations and I enjoy it always with my family. The camera coming with a good package and everything ok. Excelent zoom and resolution!
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Warranty not Honored
customer_reviews.text: In less than a year the automatic lens cover failed and the lens was not protected from debris. I shipped the camera to Canon Factory Service with the Amazon receipt as requested. They sent me a letter requesting more than half of the cost of the camera to cover repair. When I called Canon Service they offered me a lesser product in return. When I asked the representative why Canon offers an older model in return for the PowerShot SX210IS she replied, "That's just the way Canon does it." I also asked why the warranty did not cover repair costs and got the run-around.
customer_reviews.author: examan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: I researched camera reviews for about 4 months before deciding on the Canon SX210 IS. I LOVE this camera! I wanted the quality of a DSLR camera, in a point and shoot size. Well, this camera exceeds my expectations! Especially the 14x optical zoom, it's amazing! The clarity, quality and colors are excellent! I saw some personal reviews about shadowing, but none of my photos have ever had a shadow and I have taken hundreds and hundreds of photos already. All I have experienced are great photos so far. If you are considering this camera, you won't be dissappointed! Great camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Surfer mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great and the size and weight are perfect. I wanted a camera small enough to carry around in my purse but that also created great quality pictures and that is exactly what I found in this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rperalt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera. Purchased it so I would have a good camera to take on my honeymoon. The pictures were clear and I have never had a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mizer

customer_reviews.title: for $199, can't beat this! Nice pics in dark @ ISO 400. MADE IN JAPAN!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera. MADE IN JAPAN. Feels nice with aluminum body, not cheap plasticy. Pictures in restaurant at ISO 200 & 400 (without using flash) turns out very nice, provided the subjects stay still for the shot. I bought this at $199 on a sale here, and I'm loving it.
customer_reviews.author: woome2

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Very simply put, I'm technologically challenged. I can work my cell phone and do a few tricks on the computer, but when it comes to cameras, I'm about as knowledgable as a great-grandmother with dementia. All I know is to push the shutter button and smile. I love this camera. Tired of the typical Walmart $100 buys, I splurged and recieved a piece of machinery that makes even my pictures look fantastic. Listen to no one else; this is the best camera you can get for $250.
customer_reviews.author: screaminnocence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Does all that is expected. In a super small size that fits perfectly in gent's pocket or unobtrusively on belt.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This was my first digital camera that my mom got me for my birthday over 2 years ago. It's a great camera for everyday use and takes excellent pictures. I love the purple/magenta color that makes my camera very distinctive and easy to recognize. This camera has a very good zoom. Takes okay night photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with the best zoom we've found
customer_reviews.text: The zoom on this camera makes it worth the 5 stars. The flash does sometimes get in the way of my husband's hand (he's left handed and the flash pops up on left side of camera). It takes good HD movie quality video with good sound.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Mcghghy

customer_reviews.title: Just a few months after I got it, the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just a few months after I got it , the battery started running out and I can use it part of the day, and have to use my extra battery
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good brand at a very low cost
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift not expensive, very good brand and reliable. Canon is a great product cant complain. Enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Raymondcr

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a great product
customer_reviews.text: I love my new camera. Only complaint is the auto pop-up of the flash, which is located right where my left index finger wants to be. Otherwise, it's a handy size that fits in my purse and takes great pictures. The camera arrived in new condition as promised and was a terrific bargain at $55!
customer_reviews.author: Sooze Q

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for...damn like four years now! It works pretty well for the price and as taken some great pictures for me throughout the years.
customer_reviews.author: Ali B.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: I love Canons and when I decided to upgrade my "purse camera" as I like to call it...I immediately looked to Canon. I have the Rebel T1i and love it so I wanted a compact camera with good quality. I heard mixed reviews, looked at different brands and even different models within the Powershot family. SO HAPPY with my choice! I have no complaints! Btw, I take approximately 5,000 pictures a year...so many of them are with my Powershot!
customer_reviews.author: Love my canons!

customer_reviews.title: Review of Canon SX210is
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my mother who is by no means technically savvy. She has had the camera about a month and has taken it on one trip already. The camera is very easy for her to operate and the screen is improved from other Canons. The use of this camera in low light is one of many reasons I chose it. The main downside of the camera is a design flaw: where one would traditionally hold a camera there is a pop up flash which is held down by your left index finger. Avoiding this causes you to hold the camera a bit awkward.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: i like the product just use it for photos and videos
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera for the price, and I'd recommend it to a friend. There are newer models of this camera; however, getting this one saves about $150-$175 over the newer ones. As cameras go, I think you usually get more "bang for the buck" by purchasing an older one, then as you budget permitsbuying a newer model but not the newest model.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Bua

customer_reviews.title: CANNON SX 210
customer_reviews.text: REALLY EASY TO USE. TAKES GREAT PICS AND GREAT COLORATION AND SATURATION. THEY PRINT OUT GREAT AND VIVID. A GREAT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera. An excellent performer. Quality of images is great. Really nothing bad to say about it. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Blais

customer_reviews.title: camera is ok
customer_reviews.text: the camera in general is a good camera and i like most of the pictures i take with it however, the cons are that in door pics or low light pictures and video are terrible with this camera. the other bad thing about this camera is that the battery runs out pretty quickly. this cam does have a lot of options but im not a pro and dont know what adjustments to make i mostly use the auto function, sport function and night function
customer_reviews.author: omar

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera. I'm still learning some of its tricks so where I gave 4 stars, it may be me not the camera. I don't find it as intuitive to figure out as the Fuji I had, but the quality is much better. I bought it refurbished so that made it in my price range.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schnitler

customer_reviews.title: Love the Cannon
customer_reviews.text: It has great zoom and great picture quality. Sometimes the extended zoom and focus makes it a little slow but the pictures you do capture are great....
customer_reviews.author: G. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, takes great pics and has all the features you need to make manual adjustment for the perfect picture
customer_reviews.author: Danniel

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX2101S
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera. Have used it a lot and the pictures are excellent and easily transferred to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So far this camera is very nice. Still have some time to work with it though to get the full effect. Very easy to use and the photos are wonderful so far.
customer_reviews.author: TAMIKAWHITTED

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Best digital camera on the market. Great zoom and high quality photos. Easy to use and upload. Very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: great camera for novice and semi-pro
customer_reviews.text: I received the camera for Fathers day and I am very pleased so far with the many options available and most of all I am able to shoot pictures on auto or easy without thinking about settings etc. However being able to manually adjust most settings allow me to learn and acquire skill as a hobby photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Cathrin Eckle

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD - Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Decidedly slim and sleekly refined, the PowerShot SX210 IS packs a feature set that reads like a wish list. The 14.1-megapixel CCD joins a 14x 28mm wide-angle zoom for imaging power to spare. Frame your shots in the bright 3.0-inch widescreen PureColor System LCD, with the Low Light mode for sharp images in dimly-lit situations. 

It also captures stunning HD movies with Dynamic mode for enhanced image stabilization when shooting movies using wide-angle settings. Capture smooth HD video (720p) with stereo sound for a truly natural, high quality HD experience. The PowerShot SX210 IS not only goes wherever you do, but takes your photography and video to a whole new place, too. 

PowerShot SX210IS Highlights 


Powerful 14x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer
With the PowerShot SX210 IS's powerful 14x optical zoom, you'll get up-close fast, handy at sports and school events as well as everyday creative shooting. And with Optical Image Stabilizer, camera shake is greatly reduced even when shooting while walking, helping to ensure clarity and acuity in all your images. 




Improved Dynamic mode for enhanced image stabilization
Canon technology helps to ensure your high definition movies are as shake-free as your stills. When shooting movies at wide-angle settings, the PowerShot SX210 IS uses the advanced Dynamic mode to greatly reduce camera shake that can occur when you are shooting while walking. Your HD movies play back steadily and without jerky movement. 


14.1-megapixel resolution will generate 16.5 x 23.4-inch prints
For all its easy operability, the PowerShot SX210 IS nevertheless has a formidable feature set. 14.1-megapixel resolution delivers a wealth of detail to every image, and allows you to crop and enlarge any portion of your shot freely, up to poster-sized 16.5 x 23.4-inch prints. 

28mm wide-angle lens to capture more in your frame
The 28mm wide-angle lens captures more in every frame, and gives your photography more flexibility. Everyone fits in a family gathering shot. You'll capture more image in every shot, and add greater depth to your overall photography. 

3.0-inch wide PureColor System LCD
The PowerShot SX210 IS's high resolution (230,400 dots) 3.0-inch wide PureColor System LCD gives you the big picture, whether you're shooting, reviewing or showing off your images. This high-resolution screen offers a crisp, clear picture to make shooting, playback and using the camera's menu functions especially convenient. Clear and bright, it features Night Display for easy viewing in low light. 

HD shooting capability at 720p with stereo sound plus HDMI output
The PowerShot SX210 IS lets you record video in beautiful high definition (1280 x 720 pixels). The camera also makes it easy to enjoy HD movies (and still photos) on your HDTV with a mini-HDMI connector for direct connection to a high-definition TV monitor. You'll enjoy the HD experience with no degradation of image or audio in the signal, plus the ability to display up to 130 still images at once. 

The PowerShot SX210 IS also includes spectacular movie functionality. With the Movie button, simply push and you can start shooting video and never miss the perfect moment. When shooting movies, you can get up close with the 14x optical zoom for riveting detail and realism, from the overall appearance to facial expressions! And the camera's Smart AUTO technology that helps ensure the perfect still image works to bring that same quality to your movies. 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor with evolved Face Detection Technology
Canon's most advanced image processor, DIGIC 4, delivers evolved Face Detection Technology that keeps every face in every photo looking its very best. The technology finds and tracks the faces of moving subjects until you're ready to shoot, then delivers perfect focus. In addition, exposure, flash and white balance are compensated, so that faces exhibit natural skin tones and backgrounds are properly exposed. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the advanced DIGIC 4 Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

Face Detection Self-timer automatically detects an increase in the number of faces and makes the appropriate adjustments. For instance, to include the photographer's face in a group shot, there's no need to rush in. Just put the camera on a stand or tripod, specify Face Detection Self-timer, and the camera will wait for the photographer's face to get on-camera before it takes the shot. Motion Detection tracks moving subjects in a much larger range, and the Servo AF retains focus on a moving subject after the shutter button is pressed halfway--allowing you to wait for the perfect shot without refocusing. 

Intelligent Contrast Correction DIGIC 4 also makes possible the i-Contrast (Intelligent Contrast Correction) system, which controls the compensation level in pixel units to brighten dark areas while leaving bright areas unchanged for better images where the main subject is dark, and more natural transition. The PowerShot SX210 IS can even use i-Contrast in playback mode to adjust images that were shot without the setting activated. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures.
1) Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken.
2) The PowerShot SX210 IS can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback.
3) You can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Life doesn't give you second chances to capture special times. That's why the PowerShot SX210 IS features an ISO 1600 setting that reduces the effects of camera shake and sharpens subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. ISO can be expanded up to 6400 when you select Low Light mode. 

New scene modes for more creative shooting
The Canon PowerShot SX210 IS offers creative effects similar to those found in professional lenses. Miniature Effect creates an illusion where very large objects appear in miniature proportions. Turn soaring cityscapes into a scene in seemingly dollhouse-like proportions. 


Fisheye Effect uses barrel distortion to warp the image around the center, giving a distinctive curvature effect to the photo. The curvilinear images produced by Fisheye Effect can suggest the curve of the Earth, the inside of a dome, or the image you see through the peephole of a door. 

With an ISO of 400-6400, the Low Light mode takes the Canon PowerShot SX210 IS bravely into the shadows--literally! Now even scenes notorious for having insufficient light, such as those lit by candles, fire, or street lamp, come through in fantastic color and clarity, with less noise. You can keep the feel of the scene intact without adding additional light, so the result will be scenes with the visual accuracy, depth and clarity you expect from a Canon camera. 


The Canon PowerShot SX210 IS also has Smart Shutter technology, which detects faces in the scene and releases the shutter automatically in response to the appearance of an additional face, or when a smile or sassy wink occurs. These technologies help to make your photography less rushed and more natural, so getting the perfect shot is even easier. 

Smart AUTO mode intelligently selects from 22 settings


Just set the Canon PowerShot SX210 IS to Smart AUTO and you're ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It's a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 22 specially defined settings. So whether you're photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you're getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Shooting Modes
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 12 Shooting Modes plus 11 Special Scene Modes, you're ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

Servo AF/AE continues to focus and track subject
In PowerShot SX210 IS's Servo AF mode, Auto Exposure (AE) functionality is linked to the Auto Focus (AF) frame, creating a sophisticated Servo AF/AE that delivers sharp focus and proper exposure of subjects on the move. 

Now you can wait for the shot you want, with no need to reframe and refocus. With the shutter button pressed halfway, Servo AF/AE will continue to focus and track your subject as the moment you want to capture approaches. Press the shutter fully, and you've got your shot--with tight focus and perfectly calibrated exposure. 

Smart Flash Exposure
Smart Flash Exposure is a technology that can produce excellent flash exposures across a wide range of conditions, and helps ensure against over- or under-exposed images. The detail and color of your photo remain intact and truer to life even in challenging lighting. 

What's in the Box  * PowerShot SX210 IS Body 
 * Lithium-ion Battery Pack NB-5L 
 * Battery Charger CB-2LX 
 * Wrist Strap WS-DC9 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU 
 * AV Cable AVC-DC400ST
feature_bullets: Powerful 14x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer; improved Dynamic mode for enhanced image stabilization
14.1-megapixel resolution for high-quality prints up to 16.5 x 23.4 inches
28mm wide-angle lens; 3.0-inch wide PureColor System LCD
HD shooting capability at 720p with stereo sound plus HDMI output
DIGIC 4 Image Processor with evolved Face Detection Technology; new scene modes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars445 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
